# ADDITIONAL AGREEMENT No. 1

## to the MERCHANT SERVICES AGREEMENT №14/05-01

This ADDITIONAL AGREEMENT No. 1 (the "Additional Agreement") is entered into as of 19.06.2025 (the "Effective Date") to the MERCHANT SERVICES AGREEMENT №14/05-01 dd 14 of May 2025 (the "Agreement") by and between:

**NOVATUM TECH LIMITED**, a company duly organized under the laws of the United Kingdom, under No. 12170240, having its registered address at 50 Liverpool Street, London, England, EC2M 7PY (the "**Provider**"),

and

**TECHFIN SIGMA SOLUTION LTD**, a company duly organized under the laws of the United Kingdom, and having its principal office at 167.169 Great Portland Street, London, United Kingdom, W1W 5PF (the "**Customer**")

## WHERE AS,

Customer an Provider are hereinafter sometimes referred to individually as "Party" and together collectively as "Parties".

## 1. Subject of the Additional Agreement:

1.1. The Parties agreed to amend Annex No. 1 to the Agreement to read as follows

# MERCHANT SERVICES AGREEMENT №14/05-01

(the "Agreement")

This MERCHANT SERVICES AGREEMENT is entered into on this day 14 of May 2025 (the "Effective date") by and between

**NOVATUM TECH LIMITED**, a company duly organized under the laws of the United Kingdom, under No. 12170240, having its registered address at 50 Liverpool Street, London, England, EC2M 7PY (the "Provider"),

and

**TECHFIN SIGMA SOLUTION LTD**, a company duly organized under the laws of the United Kingdom, and having its principal office at 167.169 Great Portland Street, London, United Kingdom, W1W 5PF (the "Customer")

The Provider and the Customer, hereinafter each separately referred to as "Party" and/or jointly referred to as "the Parties", have signed this Agreement, hereinafter referred to as "the Agreement", as follows:

## SECTION 1. INTERPRETATION

1.1. Acquiring Partner — a financial institution responsible for handling credit and debit card transactions for the Provider, or any other Acquiring Partner as unilaterally determined by the Provider at its discretion.

1.2. Application — a form which contains detailed information on the Customer, its Online Store, types of goods and services, as well as types of Cards/APMs acceptable for payment and account number where the Transactions Amounts shall be transferred (the Settlement Account of the Customer). The Application shall come into effect and shall become Annex to this Agreement.

1.3. Authorisation — the electronic process set forth by International Payment Systems to secure approval from the Issuer for executing a Transaction, following the appropriate verification of the Card, Transaction Data, Cardholder identification, and the availability of sufficient funds in the Cardholder's account.

1.4. Alternative Payment Method or APM — refers to a payment mechanism that enables the processing of e-wallets, Virtual currencies, phone account payments, and any other mutually agreed-upon methods that fall outside the scope of the Card definition.

1.5. Alternative Payment Method System or APM System — refers to a framework that encompasses one or more APMs, and includes associated entities, organizations, software, and other related components.

1.6. Alternative Payment Method User or APM User — an individual who utilizes the APM for purchasing goods and services from the Customer in the Online Store, as well as any individual receiving funds through APM Systems.

1.7. Balance — the amount held by the Provider which is to be transferred to the Customer's Settlement Account in compliance with the terms of this Agreement.

1.8. Business Risk Assessment and Mitigation or BRAM — Mastercard program on business risk assessment and mitigation towards illegal and brand damaging activity.

1.9. Card — a payment instrument (card) bearing brands including, but not limited to, Visa, Visa Electron, MasterCard, or Maestro, employed for making payments during a Transaction.

1.10. Cardholder — an individual who utilizes the Card to purchase goods and services from the Customer in the Online Store, as well as anyone receiving funds through an Original Credit Transaction.

1.11. Business Day — a day when banks operate under normal business hours in the jurisdiction or region of the jurisdiction where the Acquiring Partner, Provider, and Customer are registered.

1.12. Cancelled Transaction or Reversal — a transaction identified as cancelled, reversed, returned, erroneous, unauthorized, failed, or otherwise considered unexecuted.

1.13. Chargeback — a request from the Issuer and/or the Cardholder to reverse a Transaction Amount, made in accordance with the guidelines and rules set by the International Payment Systems.

1.14. Confidential Information — refers to information acquired in relation to, or as a result of, the Agreement and its terms, or that pertains to the trade secrets of the Parties. This encompasses know-how, service values, customer and employee information, Card data, Transaction Data, and Cardholder information. Exclusions to Confidential Information under this Agreement are:

- Information that becomes publicly accessible either on or after the date the Agreement is signed;
- Information that is already publicly available without any wrongdoing by a Party;
- Information that was lawfully obtained by a Party prior to signing the Agreement, absent any explicit or implicit confidentiality obligations.

1.15. Data Compromise — an occurrence that results, directly or indirectly, in the unauthorized access to or disclosure of Cardholder account data or the unauthorized manipulation of Cardholder account data controls, such as Cardholder account usage and spending limits.

1.16. Data Protection Rules — refer to any applicable laws and regulations in any relevant jurisdiction concerning the privacy, use, or processing of data associated with natural persons. These rules apply to the extent that they are in force and may be updated, amended, or replaced over time.

1.17. Fee Schedule — an Appendix that is an integral part of this Agreement, detailing information such as fees, the methods by which these fees are paid, the Security Deposit, Rolling Reserve, account numbers, payment currency, and other associated parameters and fees.

1.18. Fee — the consideration paid for services rendered to the Customer as stipulated under this Agreement. The amount of the Fee is specified in the Fee Schedule to this Agreement.

1.19. Global Brand Protection Program or GBPP — Visa's Global Brand Protection Program, aimed at safeguarding card brands and consumers against illegal or activities that could damage the brand.

1.20. International Payment System — international payment system as, but not limited to, VISA Europe or Mastercard Worldwide.

1.21. Issuer — a financial institution or another legal entity issuing the Cards.

1.22. MATCH — the Mastercard Alert to Control High-risk system designed to provide Acquiring Partners with the opportunity to develop and review enhanced or incremental risk information before entering into a Customer Agreement. The MATCH database includes information about certain Customers (and their owners) that an Acquiring Partner has terminated.

1.23. Original Credit Transaction or OCT — credit transaction in which funds are transferred to a specified Card.

1.24. Online Store — the digital platform operated by the Customer for the purpose of offering its goods and services.

1.25. Pay-out — a transaction involving the transfer of funds to a designated APM User through the APM System.

1.26. Payment Gateway — A technology solution that enables the secure processing of electronic transactions, such as credit and debit card payments, between the Customer's Online Store and the financial institutions involved, including but not limited to the Acquiring Partner and/or APM Systems. The Payment Gateway acts as an intermediary to facilitate the Authorization, capture, and settlement of Transaction Amounts.

1.27. PCI SSC — Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council.

1.28. Refund — the process in which the Customer initiates the return of either the full or partial Transaction Amount to a Cardholder or APM User.

1.29. Rolling Reserve — a predetermined percentage of the Customer's total turnover, held in a non-interest-bearing account (whether separate or aggregated) for a specified duration before being released to the Customer. The Rolling Reserve is designed to cover potential losses, expenses, damages, assessments, fees, charges, penalties, sanctions, fines, interest, etc., that may occur during the execution of this Agreement due to violations of this Agreement, other relevant agreements, applicable laws and regulations, Rules of the International Payment Systems, Rules of the APM Systems, or any other applicable guidelines. The Rolling Reserve is detailed and calculated as per the stipulations in the Fee Schedule section. The Parties hereby agree that the Rolling Reserve is a financial collateral (the "Financial Collateral") in the meaning of the Applicable Law and applies to the monetary funds and their improvements, civil legal increments and fruits on accounts of the Customer secured for the benefit of the Provider that secure discharge of obligations of the Customer under the Agreement.

1.30. Rules of the International Payment System (s) or Rules of IPS — encompass any and all forms of provisions, including rules, guidelines, instructions, and recommendations, that pertain to, but are not limited to, Visa Europe and/or Mastercard Worldwide. These provisions govern aspects such as trademark usage, Transaction processing, technical standards for data handling related to Transactions, and other stipulations concerning Card acceptance or the execution of Original Credit Transactions (OCTs).

1.31. Rules of the APM System (s) — encompass any form of provisions, including but not limited to rules, guidelines, instructions, and recommendations, that are specific to each respective APM System. These provisions govern various aspects such as the use of trademarks, the processing of Transactions, technical standards for handling data relevant to Transactions, and other stipulations related to the acceptance of APMs or the execution of Pay-outs.

1.32. Security Deposit — a sum of money as outlined in the Fee Schedule, that is held by the Provider in accordance with this Agreement. This deposit serves to ensure the Customer fulfills its obligations to the Provider under the terms of the Agreement and designed to cover all and any potential losses, expenses, damages, assessments, fees, charges, penalties, sanctions, fines, interest, etc., that may occur during the execution of this Agreement due to violations of this Agreement, other relevant agreements, applicable laws and regulations, Rules of the International Payment Systems, Rules of the APM Systems, or any other applicable guidelines.

1.33. Settlement Account of the Customer — the payment/bank account of the Customer, details of which are specified in the Application.

1.34. Transaction — encompasses each of the following:

- A financial operation involving the use of a Card and/or APM, whereby a payment is initiated by the Cardholder/APM User to the Customer for goods or services as detailed in the Application;
- The funding or topping up of an existing account in an electronic environment via the use of a Card and/or APM; and/or
- An Original Credit Transaction (OCT) or Pay-out, if such services are applicable to the Customer.

1.35. Transaction Amount — the amount indicated in the request for Transaction Authorization, confirmed by the Issuer/APM System as an amount that can be withdrawn (plus any applicable Fees) from the Cardholder's or APM User's account.

1.36. Transaction Data — details pertaining to the Transaction, including information about the Card and/or APM used to conduct the Transaction, as well as the results of identification for the Cardholder or APM User.

1.37. Visa Customer Screening Service or VMSS — a database of Customers and agents whose contracts with their Acquiring Partners have been terminated for cause, using the specific listing reason codes.

Headings are provided for ease of reference and do not impact the interpretation of the Agreement.

References within the Agreement's text to Clauses, Sub-Clauses, and Appendixes pertain to the clauses, sub-clauses, and appendixes contained in this Agreement.

## SECTION 2. SCOPE OF THE AGREEMENT

2.1. This Agreement establishes and governs the legal relationship between the Parties concerning the acceptance of Cards and/or APMs (if applicable) in the Online Store, as well as any related financial settlements between the Provider and the Customer under the terms of this Agreement.

2.2. The Customer irrevocably and unconditionally authorizes the Provider to receive funds from the Acquiring Partner or APM Systems (if applicable) on the Customer's behalf.

2.3. Subject to the terms of this Agreement, Provider hereby grants to the Customer a limited, non-exclusive licence to use the Payment Gateway for the purpose of the receiving the Services under this Agreement.

2.4. The Payment Gateway may be accessed by means of an application service providing via a data processing interface established by Provider for this purpose (hereinafter – "Interface"). The Customer's data processing systems are connected to the Interface by the Client in accordance with the documentation about the Platform provided by Provider to the Client (hereinafter – "Documentation").

## SECTION 3. THE RIGHTS AND DUTIES OF THE PARTIES

3.1. The Provider will:

3.1.1. receive Transaction Amounts and Refunds from the International Payment Systems, the Acquiring Partner, or APM Systems, as applicable;

3.1.2. hold the collected Transaction Amounts, minus any applicable fees and charges as stipulated in this Agreement;

3.1.3. settle the Balance minus any applicable fees and charges to the Customer's Settlement Account; and

3.1.4. execute the transfer of an Original Credit Transaction/Pay-out sum to the Cardholder/APM User from the Balance, each time in line with the terms of this Agreement and applicable regulations. If any transfer date specified in the Fee Schedule or required under the regulations is not a Business Day, the transfer will be made on the next Business Day.

3.2. Role of the Provider as Payment Agent:

3.2.1 When executing the transfers as delineated in Clause 3.1, the Provider will function as a payment agent. In this capacity, the Provider's liability is restricted to the proper initiation of the following transactions:

- Bank transfers to the bank or financial institution maintaining the Settlement Account of the Customer;
- Bank transfers to the bank or financial institution that has issued the Card of the Cardholder;
- Execution of respective requests via the APM System; and
- Settlement of Transaction Amounts, Original Credit Transactions, and Refunds with the International Payment Systems.

3.3. The Provider will execute transfers and requests within the time frames required under applicable regulations. However, the Provider shall not be held liable for any delays in the execution of such transfers or requests that are caused by or result from:

- Late or incorrect receipt of Transaction Amounts from International Payment Systems, APM Systems, or Issuers;
- Any restrictions imposed by or on International Payment Systems, APM Systems, Acquirers, or Issuers;

Any such delays shall not be considered a breach of this Agreement by the Provider.

3.4. If, for any reason, the amount received by the Provider from the International Payment Systems, Acquiring Partner, and/or APM Systems is less than the sum of the Transaction Amounts, the Provider shall transfer to the Customer the amounts actually received, after deducting any applicable fees, charges, or other sums in accordance with Clause 3.2.

3.5. The Provider may:

3.5.1. deduct all relevant fees, charges, Chargebacks, Reversals, and Refunds in accordance with the Fee Schedule from the Transaction Amount before making the net balance available or transferring it to the Customer's Balance;

3.5.2. deduct from the Balance any amounts that are due to the Provider by the Customer from the Balance, including those that are currently due or will become due, as stipulated in this Agreement;

3.5.3. deduct any funds due to the Provider by the Customer from the Transaction Amounts received from the International Payment Systems or APM Systems. This includes but not limited to obligations that are either currently due or will become due as specified in this Agreement;

3.5.4. issue an invoice to the Customer for any remaining sums that are owed to the Provider if the Balance or the Transaction Amounts received are insufficient to cover all amounts due under this Agreement, including those specified in this Agreement;

3.5.5. retain the Customer's Transaction Amounts/Balance for up to 180 days if the Customer has deactivated their Online Stores. This provision is applicable in scenarios where the Online Store is closed, suspended, or stops accepting payments or providing services/goods without prior written notice to the Provider. This includes any significant reduction in payment acceptance or service/goods provision. Furthermore, if the Online Store is closed or suspended in part or in full, yet continues to process payments, such actions may be considered a breach of this Agreement.

3.5.6. request modifications to the Customer's website or any other relevant aspects as deemed essential to ensure compliance with the International Payment Systems' Rules. This may include, but is not limited to, regulations concerning the use of the International Payment Systems' trademarks. It should be noted that this clause is not to be interpreted as legal or compliance advice from the Provider. The Customer retains sole responsibility and liability for any violations arising from the content of their website;

3.5.7. delay/postpone the transfer or block/withhold any Transaction Amounts, or halt the processing of any Transaction, if there are grounds to suspect the transaction is illegal, or if there are questions concerning the Customer's activities. This action may also be taken to adhere to the International Payment Systems' Rules, including but not limited to the BRAM and GBPP rules, or the Rules of the APM System;

3.5.8. delay/postpone the transfer or block/withhold any Transaction Amounts for up to 180 calendar days if they are related to Transactions involving Chargebacks or Reversals. If a Chargeback/Reversal is invalidated based on the International Payment Systems' Rules or the APM System's Rules, or is retracted by the Issuer, the Provider will transfer the corresponding funds to the Customer within 30 Business Days of receiving the sums. If a Chargeback/Reversal is upheld, the sums will be used to offset liabilities towards the Cardholder/APM User and will not be transferred to the Customer. For clarity, the Customer remains liable for Chargebacks/Reversals even after the termination of this Agreement, for as long as such Chargebacks/Reversals can be initiated according to the applicable rules;

3.5.9. suspend the acceptance of Cards, account usage, and the processing of Transactions, Refunds, OCTs, and Pay-outs, as well as the transfer of Transaction Amounts. This action will be taken if the Provider has reasonable suspicion that associated Transactions are connected to money laundering or the financing of terrorism. The suspension will remain in effect until the Provider is sufficiently satisfied upon clarification of all relevant circumstances;

In each case the Provider shall have absolute discretion regarding when to resume accepting Cards, operating the account, processing Transactions, Refunds, OCTs, Pay-outs and transferring the Transaction Amounts, taking into account the available information and any recommendations of the International Payment Systems;

3.5.9.1. suspend, with immediate effect, the acceptance of Cards, the use of the account, the processing of Transactions, Refunds, OCTs, Pay-outs and transfers of the Transaction Amounts until all the circumstances are clarified to the Provider's satisfaction if the Customer and/or the Online Store breaches the Agreement; the laws applicable to the Customer and /or the Online Store; or the Rules of the International Payment Systems or APM Systems.

The Provider holds sole discretion to determine the timing and conditions under which the acceptance of Cards, account operation, processing of Transactions, Refunds, OCTs, Pay-outs, and transfers of Transaction Amounts may be resumed. Such decisions will be made in light of available information and any guidelines provided by the International Payment Systems.

3.5.10. temporarily suspend Services under this Agreement If modifications to the Rules of the International Payment Systems/APM Systems occur, making it either impractical or not cost-effective, in the Provider's reasonable judgment, to continue offering Services under this Agreement; and/or if the Customer is suspected of violating those Rules or relevant laws;

3.5.11. immediately halt all acceptance of Cards, account operations, and the processing of Transactions, Refunds, OCTs, and Pay-outs, as well as the transfer of Transaction Amounts, if the volume of Chargebacks in a single calendar month surpasses any of the benchmarks set forth in the Fee Schedule.

3.5.12. cease, effective immediately, the acceptance of Cards, the usage of the account, and the facilitation of Transactions, Refunds, OCTs, and Pay-outs, in addition to the transfer of Transaction Amounts, if the incidence of fraudulent transactions within a single calendar month crosses any of the thresholds identified in the Fee Schedule.

3.6. The Customer shall:

3.6.1. specify the exact URL(s) and make periodic amendments to these URLs or add new ones upon written consent from the Provider. Any new URLs will be subject to the same terms as existing ones.

3.6.2. accept card payments from Cardholders and Alternative Payment Methods (APM) without any form of bias. Further, provide the Cardholder or APM User the freedom to select their preferred method of payment for the products or services available in the Customer's Online Store;

3.6.3. only accept Card or Alternative Payment Method (APM) payments for goods and services that align with the business activities specified by the Customer in the Application;

3.6.4. only commence an Original Credit Transaction/Pay-out for goods and services that match the business activities outlined by the Customer in their Application. To clarify, an Original Credit Transaction/Pay-out should only be initiated once the transaction is finalized, and it should be conducted in the specified currency and within the designated timeframe;

3.6.5. abide by all relevant laws and regulations, particularly those related to consumer protection, distance selling, and e-commerce, in each jurisdiction where the Customer offers goods and/or services. This includes, but is not limited to, Data Protection Rules, advertising guidelines, International Payment Systems' rules, and any other regulations applicable to the Customer at any given time.

3.6.6. submit a complete Application in digital form to the Provider for each new Online Store.

3.6.7. ensure that the Online Store is in compliance with the details outlined in the Application.

3.6.8. follow the Provider's rules, as well as the regulations and technical requirements established by the International Payment Systems and APM Systems.

3.6.9. clearly identify themselves within the Online Store to allow Cardholders or APM Users to easily distinguish the Customer from other parties involved in the transaction process.

3.6.10. inform Cardholders and APM Users that the Customer is solely responsible for delivering the purchased goods and/or services and for addressing any related questions or complaints.

3.6.11. process refunds to Cardholders or APM Users, either in full or in part, based on the Customer's cancellation policy, if the goods or services acquired through the Transaction are rejected by the Cardholder or APM User;

3.6.12. return the Transaction Amount to the Cardholder or APM User as mandated by the rules of the International Payment Systems or APM Systems.

3.6.13. display the logos of the Cards and APMs accepted by the Online Store in its digital interface throughout the duration of this Agreement. The logos must not be displayed in a manner that implies sponsorship, endorsement, or direct involvement of the International Payment Systems or APM Systems in the Online Store's goods or services.

3.6.14. Promptly remove all Card or APM Systems logos from the Online Store's digital interface upon the termination of this Agreement for any reason.

3.6.15. adhere to PCI-DSS standards and maintain valid documentation proving PCI compliance. The Customer is responsible for implementing a Data Compromise policy within its organization.

3.6.16. not capture, record, or intercept any Cardholder's sensitive account information, such as card numbers. The Customer acknowledges the strict security regulations set by the International Payment Systems and PCI SSC to protect Cardholder data. Failure to comply with these rules could result in fines imposed by the International Payment Systems. If the Provider has reason to believe the Customer is in violation of these rules, the Provider reserves the right to inspect the Customer's facilities, suspend Transaction processing, and halt any fund transfers.

3.6.17. fully indemnify the Provider and absolve them of any responsibility for losses, claims (including fines imposed by International Payment Systems), costs, or damages that may arise due to the Customer's failure to fulfill this obligation. Should there be any breach or compromise of data pertaining to Cardholder/APM User's account information or sensitive authentication details, the Customer is required to immediately inform the Provider. In addition, the Customer must adhere strictly to the security protocols related to the Cardholder/APM User's account data, as outlined in this Agreement, and in accordance with applicable laws, the rules of International Payment Systems (for example, Mastercard's Site Data Protection Program), the Rules of the APM Systems, and PCI Security Standards Council guidelines, such as PCI DSS.

3.6.18. strictly adhere to the Business Risk Assessment and Mitigation (BRAM) and Global Brand Protection Program (GBPP) guidelines. In any instance of non-compliance or suspected non-compliance, the Customer must immediately notify the Provider. For the most current guidelines and rules on BRAM and GBPP, the Customer should refer to the following online resources: https://globalrisk.mastercard.com/online_resource/business-risk-assessment-and-mitigation-bram-compliance-program/ https://www.visa.co.uk/dam/VCOM/download/about-visa/visa-rules-public.pdf

3.6.19. execute Know Your Customer (KYC) checks in accordance with national legal requirements or as advised periodically by the Provider or International Payment Systems. This includes adherence to laws and regulations aimed at combatting money laundering and the financing of terrorism. The Customer must also undertake, and keep records of, any risk and/or fraud assessments and/or investigations, ensuring that these actions are in full compliance with anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing laws and regulations.

3.6.20. educate its employees, officers, and any related individuals about the principal aspects of this Agreement, the Rules of the International Payment Systems, the Rules of the Alternative Payment Methods (APM) Systems, and the Provider's guidelines. Additionally, the Customer is required to regularly oversee and ensure that these individuals maintain ongoing compliance with this Agreement, the Rules of the International Payment Systems, the Rules of the APM Systems, and the Provider's guidelines for the entire duration of this Agreement.

3.6.21. inform the Provider without undue delay after discovering an unauthorised, incorrectly executed or unexecuted payment Transaction.

3.6.22. promptly and without undue delay notify the Provider upon becoming aware or suspecting any instances of fraud or other illegal activities involving Cards or Alternative Payment Methods (APMs).

3.6.23. follow both the Provider's and the International Payment Systems' rules and recommendations regarding chargebacks. The same adherence to rules is required when considering reversals, specifically those of the Alternative Payment Methods (APMs).

3.6.24. cooperate with the Provider on any inquiries related to chargebacks or reversals.

3.6.25. upon the Provider's request, provide documents and explanations concerning any Chargebacks or Reversals within 3 business days.

3.6.26. decide within 3 business days whether to accept or dispute a chargeback or reversal and notify the Provider accordingly.

3.6.27. maintain records of all transactions and refunds for a minimum of five years, unless otherwise required by law, and must make these available to the Provider upon request.

3.6.28. notify the Provider within 3 business days of any changes to information previously provided, such as operational changes. Any such changes require written approval from the Provider.

3.6.29. provide the Provider with the correct recipient Cardholder/APM User's details and Transaction details (namely Transaction amount, Transaction currency).

3.6.30. provide and maintain a Security Deposit and/or Rolling Reserve in accordance with the Agreement and as specified in the Fee Schedule. Should the balance in either the Rolling Reserve or Security Deposit fall below the minimum required level, or go into negative territory due to any deductions, adjustments, or other events, the Customer is obligated to restore these funds to the agreed-upon levels within a maximum of 3 business days.

3.6.31. within 5 days after notice pay to and/or reimburse the Provider with:

3.6.31.1. the Fees due to the Provider by the Customer as set out in the Fee Schedule in the manner described therein;

3.6.31.2. the amount of any Refunds;

3.6.31.3. any Chargeback Processing Fees in such amounts as are set by the International Payment Systems;

3.6.31.4. the amount of any justified Chargeback/Reversal;

3.6.31.5. all charges, costs, expenses and/or damages imposed on the Provider by the International Payment Systems in connection with any breach of the Rules of the International Payment Systems and/or this Agreement by the Customer;

3.6.31.6. all charges, costs, expenses and/or damages imposed on the Provider by the APM Systems in connection with any breach of the Rules of the APM Systems and/or this Agreement by the Customer;

3.6.31.7. all charges, costs, expenses and/or damages or losses (whether indirect or consequential) caused to the Provider by any non-fulfilment of the Customer's obligations to the Provider under this Agreement;

3.6.31.8. all charges, costs, expenses and/or damages caused to the Provider by any actions or inactions of the Customer in breach of applicable laws and/or regulations; and

3.6.31.9. any indemnity due to the Provider in accordance with this Agreement.

3.7. Additional Liabilities and Indemnification:

In addition to any other liabilities under this Agreement, the Customer agrees to indemnify and hold the Provider harmless against any damages, losses, costs, charges, penalties, assessments, and fines that may be levied on the Provider due to:

3.7.1. The Customer's failure to provide settlement account details within a period of 10 calendar days.

3.7.2. The freezing or seizure of the Customer's funds due to a sanction or directive issued by financial regulatory authorities or other governmental bodies.

3.7.3. The Customer's failure to provide Know Your Customer (KYC) information for its customers upon the Provider's request within 10 business days.

3.7.4. Any breach by the Customer of this Agreement, Rules of the International Payment Systems/APMs, or any applicable laws and regulations.

3.7.5. The Customer's failure to adhere to PCI DSS guidelines and provisions, and to compensate the Provider for any resulting damages.

3.8. Prohibited Actions by the Customer.

The Customer shall not:

3.8.1. impose surcharges for card payments unless fully compliant with the laws, regulations, and International Payment System Rules, provided they don't conflict with said laws and regulations;

3.8.2. establish different transaction limits for various payment methods or card brands;

3.8.3. accept cards/APMs for goods and services other than listed in the Application;

3.8.4. accept cards/APMs when there is reason to suspect fraudulent use or identity concerns unless it has taken verification steps;

3.8.5. provide cash to the cardholder/APM user within a transaction;

3.8.6. issue commercial checks, bills, or other payment instruments within a transaction;

3.8.7. divide a Transaction into parts;

3.8.8. use cards/APMs for third-party commercial activity;

3.8.9. issue electronic money unless authorized by a regulatory body and approved by the Provider;

3.8.10. use transaction data for any other purpose except for lawful processing in line with International Payment Systems/APM rules; and

3.8.11. store complete card numbers.

3.9. In addition to the rights of set-off, retention and deduction, the Customer irrevocably authorises the Provider, without any additional agreement or authorisation, to deduct from the Balance and from the Security Deposit and/or Rolling Reserve the amounts required in order to satisfy the amounts due to the Provider under this Agreement.

## SECTION 4. WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS OF THE CUSTOMER

4.1. The Customer represents and warrants to the Provider that:

4.1.1. it conducts its business in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and ordinances;

4.1.2. it is financially solvent and capable of fulfilling all financial obligations outlined in this Agreement;

4.1.3. it has the full corporate power and authority to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement;

4.1.4. all information provided to the Provider, either directly or indirectly, is accurate, complete, and current as of the date of this Agreement;

4.1.5. it will maintain appropriate security measures to protect against unauthorized access to or unauthorized alteration, disclosure, or destruction of data;

4.1.6. its activity and all activity within the Online Store complies with all applicable laws and regulations and with the Rules of the International Payment Systems/APM Systems;

4.1.7. International Payment Systems are sole and exclusive owners of their trademarks and Customers shall not contest the ownership of such trademarks for any reason;

4.1.8. APM Systems are sole and exclusive owners of their trademarks and Customers shall not contest the ownership of such trademarks for any reason;

4.1.9. International Payment Systems/APM Systems may at any time immediately and without advance notice, prohibit the Customer from using any of the Marks for any reason;

4.1.10. it accepts that the International Payment Systems/APM Systems have the right to enforce any provision of their rules and to prohibit the Customer and/or Provider from engaging in any conduct the International Payment Systems/APM Systems deem could injure or could create a risk of injury to the International Payment Systems/APM Systems, including injury to reputation, or that could adversely affect the integrity of the interchange system or the International Payment Systems/APM Systems' confidential information (as defined by International Payment Systems/APM Systems);

4.1.11. the Customer will not take any action that could interfere with or prevent the exercise of these rights of the International Payment Systems stipulated in this Agreement;

4.1.12. it will not misrepresent itself as being an Acquiring Partner or Provider to any third party;

4.1.13. it will not impose a requirement that the Cardholder/APM User waives a right to dispute a Transaction on the Website(s);

4.1.14. it will not directly or indirectly require any Cardholder/APM User to pay a surcharge in connection with a Transaction or must not add any amount over the advertised or normal price to a Transaction, unless applicable laws or regulations expressly require that a Customer be permitted to impose a surcharge;

4.1.15. it will store a credential for a future Transaction If only the Customer has obtained the Cardholder's express informed consent to an agreement that contains all of the required information;

4.1.16. it will not store Visa Secure or Mastercard ID check verification data as well as shall not sell, purchase, provide, exchange or in any manner disclose Account or Transaction data.

4.2. Chargeback/Reversal Disputes

Should the Customer choose to contest a Chargeback or Reversal, the Customer will be responsible for all related costs, including but not limited to, fees for reviewing the Chargeback/Reversal, any additional processing fees, and any potential arbitration expenses. Initiating a dispute over a Chargeback/Reversal will not impede the Provider's rights, as outlined in this Agreement, to withhold the disputed funds.

4.3. Data and Cardholder Information Compromise

In the event that the Customer becomes involved in the compromise of cardholder data, as per the Guidelines of International Payment Systems, the Customer is obligated to work cooperatively with both the Provider and the International Payment Systems, supplying all required documentation and information.

4.4. Compliance with Change Requests

The Customer hereby agrees unconditionally to accommodate reasonable requests for changes by the Provider. This includes, but is not limited to, the implementation of new or additional risk management measures as deemed necessary by the Provider, International Payment Systems, or Alternative Payment Method (APM) Systems.

## SECTION 5. DISCLAIMER, LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INDEMNITY

5.1. Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, all and any services are provided on an "AS IS" basis as available and with all fault's basis. To the extent permitted by law, Provider disclaims all implied conditions, representations, and warranties of any kind, including any implied warranty or condition of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title or non-infringement. Provider makes no representations, warranties, conditions of guarantees as to the usefulness, quality, suitability, or completeness of the services or that they will be error-free, uninterrupted, or free from defect.

5.2. Neither Party shall be liable for:

5.2.1. Any business interruption, loss of profits, loss of business, loss of revenue, loss of goodwill, loss of opportunity, loss or injury to reputation or loss of anticipated savings; and

5.2.2. Any indirect or consequential loss or damage.

5.3. Each Party's liability to the other for fraud or for death or personal injury resulting from its negligence shall be unlimited.

5.4. Subject to Clause 5.1., the Provider's aggregate liability to the Customer under this Agreement shall be limited to €10000 (ten thousand euro and 00 cents).

5.5. The Provider will not be liable to Customer if the Provider executes a payment transaction in accordance with the Cardholder/APM User's details and Transaction details provided to it by the Customer, but where those details were incorrect. Such transactions shall be deemed to be correctly executed by the Provider and shall not be construed as unexecuted or incorrectly executed payment transactions for which the Provider may have liability. However, the Provider will make reasonable efforts to recover the funds involved in the payment transaction and the Customer agrees that the Provider may charge the Customer for its actual costs in attempting any such recovery.

5.6. Subject to Clause 5.1., the Provider shall not be liable to the Customer for:

5.6.1. Any loss or damage of a type which was not reasonably foreseeable when this Agreement was concluded, whether or not the possibility of that type of loss or damage was subsequently advised to or otherwise became known, or should have become known to the Provider after the date of this Agreement; or

5.6.2. Any claim where the circumstances giving rise to a claim were caused by the Provider's compliance with applicable laws and regulations or the Rules of International Payment Systems; or

5.6.3. Any loss or damage to the extent that the Customer contributed to that loss or damage by any action or omission (whether negligent or not) and the respective liability of the Customer in that instance shall be determined in accordance with the principles of contributing negligence; or

5.6.4. The actions or inactions of any intermediary service provider appointed by the Provider, and the Provider's liability in such instance shall be limited to using reasonable care in the selection, appointment and instruction of such intermediary service provider (but not of any third party such provider may use); or

5.6.5. Any delay or shortfall in the receipt of funds from the International Payment Systems;

5.6.6. Any failure or disruption in the technical infrastructure which the Customer uses if such failure or disruption is due to abnormal and unforeseen circumstances or is beyond the Provider's control.

5.7. Where the Customer acts as payer, the Provider will be liable to refund to the Customer any incorrectly executed or unauthorised transactions in accordance with the regulations. The Provider's liability to the Customer for any unexecuted or incorrectly executed or unauthorised Transaction, Refunds or any unauthorised payment order shall be limited:

5.7.1. To the amount of the respective payment transaction plus an amount to restore the Customer's Ballance to the state in which it would have been had the defective Transaction or Refunds not taken place plus any charges for which the Customer is responsible and any interest which the Customer must pay as a consequence of the non-execution, defective or unauthorised execution of the Transaction or Refunds; and

5.7.2. To those Transactions where the Customer notified the Provider without undue delay using the contact details on becoming aware that unauthorised, unexecuted or incorrectly executed Transaction or Refunds in any event within thirteen (13) months of the date on which the Provider made the relevant Transaction Data and information about the Refund available to the Customer in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

5.8. Provider does not assume liability for Customer's failure to perform in accordance with this Agreement or a results cause by Customer's acts, omissions or negligence or a subcontractor or an agent of Customer or an employee of Customer or any of Customer's agents or subcontractors, nor shall the Provider have any liability for claims of third parties, including, but not limited to claims of third parties arising out of resulting from, or in connection with Customer's products, descriptions, representations, messages, programs, caller contracts, promotions, advertising infringement, or any claim for libel or slander or for Customer's violation of copyright, trademark or other intellectual property rights. Unless there is a specific, written agreement otherwise Customer acknowledges and agrees that the relationship in connection with this Agreement is with Provider and not International Payment Systems. Accordingly, the Customer shall seek no resource against International Payment Systems and International Payment Systems shall have any liability whatsoever to Customer, for any direct or indirect damages arising out of this Agreement, including but not limited to services performed hereunder. Customer waives any claim against Provider other than Provider's breach of the terms of this Agreement regarding acceptance or denial of any card payment by an acquiring bank or use of any other payment type.

5.9. Customer shall exercise the degree of care and expertise expected of a responsible business person and shall be liable for and shall indemnify the Provider from and against all expenses, costs, claims, fines, obligations or any liability and all other damage or loss to the Provider arising from any breach by the Customer of its obligations under this Agreement and/or of applicable laws and regulations and/or of the Rules of International Payment Systems.

5.10. Each Party shall be exempted from liability for total or partial non-performance of its obligations, as well as for improper performance of its obligations under this Agreement, if such failure resulted from any event beyond its reasonable control (including acts of God, fires, explosions, accident, floods, earthquakes, storms, embargoes, strikes, lock-outs, labour disputes, epidemic, war, acts of terrorism or nuclear disaster)(an "Event of Force Majeure"). At the commencement and cessation of an Event of Force Majeure, the Party whose performance was impeded shall immediately, and no later than 3 (three) Business Days after becoming aware of the Event of Force Majeure, inform the other Parties about the Event of Force Majeure, giving evidence of the existence of that Event of Force Majeure and its impact on that Party's ability to perform. If a Party fails to give timely notice under this Clause that Party shall be liable to the other Parties for any damages caused to those other Parties by the absence of, or delay in, the notification.

5.11. The Party whose performance is impeded by an Event of Force Majeure shall be excused from performing to the extent that obligations were directly influenced by the Event of Force Majeure and the other Parties shall not be obliged to pay for services under this Agreement which are not delivered; all obligations which are unaffected by that Event of Force Majeure shall continue to be subject to proper performance in accordance with this Agreement.

5.12. A Party whose performance is impeded by an Event of Force Majeure shall take all reasonable measures to eliminate that Event of Force Majeure and its consequences.

5.13. If an Event of Force Majeure or its consequences last for more than 20 (twenty) calendar days, the Parties shall cooperate with the aim of amending those provisions in this Agreement that have been affected by the Event of Force Majeure. If such written agreement is not reached within the next following 5 (five) calendar days, any Party may give 5 (five) calendar days' notice in writing to the others unilaterally suspending its performance under this Agreement.

5.14. Provider will defend, indemnify and hold the Customer and its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, and agents harmless against any loss, damage or costs (including reasonable attorneys' fees) incurred in connection with claims, demands, suits, or proceedings made or brought by a third party ("Claim(s)") against Customer alleging that the use of the services as contemplated hereunder infringes the intellectual property rights of a third party provided that for the above Customer Provider (a) promptly gives written notice of the Claim to Provider; (b) gives Provider sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim; and (c) provides to Provider, all reasonable assistance requested by Provider. The foregoing indemnity will not apply to any third party claim that arises solely from Customer's use, operation or combination of the services with non-Providers programs, data or equipment, modifications or alterations not made or authorized by Provider, Customer provider's breach of this Agreement or gross negligence or willful misconduct. In the event that the provisions of this Clause 5.14 state the sole, exclusive and entire liability of Provider, and the sole, exclusive and entire remedy of Customer, with respect to any claim of patent, copyright, trade secret, trademark or other Intellectual Property infringement by the services.

5.15. Customer will defend, indemnify and hold Provider and its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, and agents harmless against any Claims against Provider arising out of (i) Customer's breach of this Agreement regarding the services hereunder, including but not limited to claims related to end-user customer use; (ii) and any Claim involving misuse or loss of end-user customer information by Customer including loss due to security breach; (iii) and any Claim relating to any taxes chargeable or payable on the transaction; (iv) in respect of any Claim, penalty, fine or loss relating to any improper, unauthorized, illegal, and/or fraudulent transactions; and (v) act of negligence, actions in breach of International Payment System rules.

## SECTION 6. SET-OFF

6.1. Provider's Rights for Financial Recourse

The Customer acknowledges and agrees that, aside from any other remedies the Provider may possess, the Provider has the right to:

6.1.1. Offset any liabilities that the Customer owes to the Provider under this Agreement against any funds that the Provider owes to the Customer; and/or

6.1.2. Hold funds in any of the Customer's accounts with the Provider (except those specifically designated as client funds) until such time that the Provider reasonably believes that the Customer has met all its obligations under this Agreement; and/or

6.1.3. Withdraw amounts due from any of the Customer's accounts with the Provider (excluding accounts designated for client funds) to satisfy any outstanding debts the Customer owes to the Provider.

6.2. Currency Conversion for Offsetting Obligations

Should the obligations between the Parties be denominated in different currencies, the Provider reserves the right to perform currency conversion at its unilateral discretion, to facilitate the offset or deduction of such obligations.

6.3. Restrictions on Customer Accounts

While the Customer has pending obligations to the Provider under this Agreement, the Customer shall not have the right to pledge, charge, mortgage, assign, transfer, or otherwise secure funds in any of its accounts with the Provider in any manner.

## SECTION 7. SECURITY DEPOSIT AND ROLLING RESERVE

7.1. Security Deposit

7.1.1. Upon receipt of the Transaction Amounts from the International Payment Systems, the Provider shall deduct the Security Deposit in the amount specified in the Fee Schedule.

7.1.2. The Provider shall hold the Security Deposit for the whole period of the Agreement and one hundred eight (180) days after its termination/expiration unless otherwise specified in the Fee Schedule.

7.1.3. The Customer shall not be entitled to dispose of the Security Deposit in any way.

7.1.4. The Provider shall release and return the Security Deposit to the Customer via a transfer to the Settlement Account of the Customer within a reasonable period of time, but in any case not more than 30 days after the end of the period specified in accordance with Clause 7.1.2.

7.1.5. The Provider may, unilaterally and without prior notification to the Customer, use the Security Deposit to:

7.1.5.1. Return Transaction Amounts to the Cardholder/APM User for justified Chargebacks, Reversals and Refunds;

7.1.5.2. Pay all sums due to the Provider under this Agreement; and

7.1.5.3. Secure the performance of any obligations under this Agreement.

7.1.6. In case the laws applicable to Customer require any registration, certification, public notification, or any other legal actions in order to the Security Deposit to be valid and lawfully executed, the Customer shall perform all such actions within the term set out in the applicable laws.

7.1.7. No interests shall apply to the amount of the Security Deposit

7.2. Rolling Reserve

7.2.1. The Provider shall be entitled to withhold the Rolling Reserve until complete discharge of obligations under the Agreement by the Customer.

7.2.2. The volume of obligations of the Customer shall be determined solely by Provider upon maturity of the specified obligations including penalty and interest.

7.2.3. In case the Customer shall not carry out their obligations and fulfil them only in parts, the Provider may unilaterally and without prior notification to the Customer use the Rolling Reserve for paying off the obligations of the Customer. In this case the Provider is entitled to write off monetary funds from any account of the Customer with the Provider for the benefit of the Provider in order to pay off the obligations of the Customer.

7.2.4. During the obligations of the Customer, the Customer shall not be entitled to pledge and re-pledge, transfer for possession, encumber, alienate, change the composition and legal form of the Rolling Reserve (as well as the right on the Rolling Reserve), or to take actions that can reduce its value.

7.2.5. The Provider shall hold the Rolling Reserve for the period specified in the Fee Schedule, until such time as it is released in accordance with this Agreement.

7.2.6. The Provider shall release and return the Rolling Reserve to the Customer via a transfer to the Settlement Account of the Customer within a reasonable period of time, but in any case not more than 30 days after the end of the period specified in the Fee Schedule but subject to Clause 7.2.1.

7.2.7. Customer shall inform third parties of the existing Rolling Reserve. In Customer conclude a deal regarding the monetary funds being in Rolling Reserve, such deal is considered invalid from the moment it has been concluded. In case the laws applicable to Customer require any registration, certification, public notification, or any other legal actions in order to the Rolling Reserve to be valid and lawfully executed, the Customer shall perform all such actions within the term set out in the applicable laws.

7.2.8. Depending on the payment method, rules and regulations, and any arrangements with Acquiring Partners, APM Systems or any other providers engaged to the Services, the Provider may request additional securities and collaterals (or increase the existing ones) with prior written notice. The Customer hereby confirms and agrees that any refusal from execution of any of such securities and collaterals may result in full or partial cessation of the Services under this Agreement.

## SECTION 8. CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS

8.1. Confidentiality Commitment

Both Parties agree to hold all Confidential Information in the strictest confidence and neither Party shall disclose such information without the written approval of the other, except as outlined in Clauses 8.2 to 8.4.

8.2. Permitted Disclosures

8.3. Each Party can disclose Confidential Information without the need for prior consent under the following circumstances:

8.3.1. When mandated by the applicable laws or regulations;

8.3.2. When requested by a government agency, law enforcement body, or court with jurisdiction over the Party in question;

8.3.3. To disclose Transaction Data and information regarding Refunds and Chargebacks to International Payment Systems or APMs, and other participants reasonably involved in the transaction;

8.3.4. When sharing information with professional advisors who are under a confidentiality obligation concerning that information.

8.4. Provider's Right to Disclose to International Payment Systems

The Provider reserves the right to share Confidential Information about the Customer with International Payment Systems, in alignment with the rules governing these systems.

8.5. Disclosure of Agreement

Each Party may publicly disclose the existence of this Agreement without requiring the prior approval of the other Party.

8.6. Post-Termination Obligations

The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Clause 8 shall continue to apply even after the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

## SECTION 9. TERM AND TERMINATION

9.1. The Agreement shall come into effect as soon as signed by all Parties and shall remain in force until terminated in accordance with its terms. In all circumstances, in the event of a contradiction between this Agreement and documents issued by the Provider, this Agreement prevails and has a retroactive effect in relation to all and any agreements, concluded between the Parties and in relation to all activities which were made by the Customer and all Provider services, which were used by Customer.

9.2. Each of the Parties may terminate the Agreement by giving 2 (two) months' notice in writing to the other Parties.

9.3. The Provider has the right to terminate the Agreement immediately without notice if:

9.3.1. The Customer has given inaccurate information to the Provider about its financial position and such statements influenced the Providers decision to enter into this Agreement, to assume a particular level of risk, and/or to set the security requirements at a particular level; or

9.3.2. There is a considerable worsening of the Customer's financial position or in the value of any security (including the Security Deposit and Rolling Reserve) provided by the Customer, or there is a threat of such worsening which calls into question the Customer's ability to satisfy its obligations under the Agreement; or

9.3.3. Either the Customer is unable to pay its debts as they fall due; suspends making payments on any of its debts; commences negotiations with its creditors with a view to rescheduling any indebtedness; has a moratorium declared in respect of its assets; is subject to any action, proceedings or another step to wind up, dissolve, administer, liquidate, receive assets of, or reorganize that entity, or any analogous process in any jurisdiction; or if it disposes of its operation or business, either in whole or in part, outside the ordinary course of business; or

9.3.4. The Customer fails to comply with a request to increase the amount of the Security Deposit and/or Rolling Reserve within a period of time set by the Provider, acting reasonably; or

9.3.5. The Customer action and/or failure to act may cause/causes AML/TF risk for Provider or Customer operations are carried out in an unsound or unsafe manner;

9.3.6. The Customer does not comply with or repeatedly does not comply with this Agreement and/or applicable law and regulation and/or Rules of the International Payment Systems within any period of time set by the Provider, acting reasonably; or

9.3.7. The proportion and/or the number of Chargebacks arising from the Transactions exceeds the limits set out in the Fee Schedule; or

9.3.8. The proportion and/or the number and/or the amount of fraudulent Transactions, conducted via the Cards, exceeds the limits set out in the Fee Schedule;

9.3.9. Notwithstanding the above mentioned, if Customer has operated in the breach of this Agreement under sole opinion of the Provider or undertaken any other activity that in the view of the Provider could result in loss to Provider or International Payment Systems

9.3.10. Any other activity that may result in undue economic hardship or damage to the goodwill of the Payment Systems, if the Customer fails to take corrective action within 5 (five) working days after the given notification.

9.3.11. The Acquiring Partner or Payment Systems has requested to terminate the agreement.

9.3.12. if Acquiring Partner loses its license and is not substituted by another Acquiring Partner holding a valid license.

9.4. Either the Provider or the Customer may terminate this Agreement immediately if the Provider or the Customer becomes insolvent.

9.5. The expiry or termination of the Agreement shall not prejudice the accrued rights of any Party.

9.6. In the event that the Agreement is terminated, any charges already paid to the Provider under the Agreement will not be refunded.

9.7. Customer agrees that should this Agreement be terminated due to the breach of the Agreement by the Customer, Provider holds the unconditional right to provide the Customer data to MATCH or VMSS.

## SECTION 10. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION

10.1. This Agreement is governed by the laws of United Kingdom.

10.2. In carrying out any activities under this Agreement, the Parties shall observe the laws of United Kingdom and the Rules of the International Payment Systems. In case of discrepancies between the laws of United Kingdom and the Rules of the International Payment Systems, the laws of United Kingdom shall prevail.

10.3. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, including any question regarding its existence, validity, or termination, shall be referred to and finally resolved by the courts United Kingdom, which shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any such disputes.

## SECTION 11. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY AND LICENCES

11.1. No Transfer of Intellectual Property Rights

This Agreement does not convey any ownership of Intellectual Property Rights from the Provider to the Customer. Any Intellectual Property Rights owned by the Provider or developed during the term of this Agreement shall remain the exclusive property of the Provider.

11.2. Limited License to Customer

The Customer may be granted a non-transferable, non-exclusive, revocable, and royalty-free license to use the Provider's trademark, but only if such usage is agreed upon through a written agreement signed by both Parties and is consistent with the objectives of this Agreement.

11.3. Limited License to Provider

The Provider is granted a non-transferable, non-exclusive, revocable, and royalty-free license to use the Customer's trademark for purposes aligned with this Agreement. The Provider agrees to adhere to the Customer's guidelines for using said trademark and acknowledges that this license may be modified or terminated at any time, effective immediately.

11.4. Brand Guidelines Compliance

Both Parties shall abide by the brand guidelines and intellectual property rules that the other Party may provide, and will adhere to any updates or modifications to these guidelines as communicated from time to time.

## SECTION 12. GENERAL PROVISIONS

12.1. Currency Conversion

Should any Party need to convert currency for fulfilling obligations under this Agreement, the conversion rate determined by the Provider at the time of conversion will be used.

12.2. Fees for Unstipulated Services

Any services provided by the Provider to the Customer that are not explicitly outlined in this Agreement will be billed according to the Provider's standard fee schedule.

12.3. Assignment by Customer

The Customer may not transfer or assign its rights and responsibilities under this Agreement without the Provider's prior written approval.

12.4. Third-Party Rights

No clause in this Agreement is intended to grant rights or benefits to anyone who is not a party to this Agreement.

12.5. Assignment by Provider

The Provider reserves the right to assign its obligations and rights under this Agreement to another entity at its discretion. Such an assignment will not affect the Customer's rights under this Agreement.

12.6. Amendments

The Provider shall inform the Customer in writing, which may include via email, of any proposed amendments to this Agreement. Unless the Customer submits a written objection received by the Provider before the amendments take effect, the changes will be considered accepted and will become effective on the specified date, which shall be no less than two months from the notice date.

12.7. Communication

All correspondence and notifications related to this Agreement must be in English and delivered in writing to each Party's designated contacts. Such correspondence will be considered delivered according to the delivery methods agreed upon by both Parties.

Contact email of the Provider: support@novatumtech.uk

Contact person of the Customer shall be as set out in the Application Form. It is the responsibility of the Customer to inform the Provider of any changes to the contact details.

12.8. This Agreement shall be legally binding for the legal successors and assigns of the Parties.

12.9. If any provision of this Agreement becomes invalid, the other provisions shall remain effective and shall be interpreted in the context of the aims of the Parties and in accordance with applicable laws. If there Is any contradiction between this Agreement and the Rules of the International Payment Systems/APM Systems, the Rules of the International Payments Systems/APM Systems shall prevail.

12.10. This Agreement has been drawn up in the English language in two copies. Each copy shall have equal legal effect. Each Party shall get one copy of this Agreement.
